intro: Gnaphalium adenocarpum, commonly known as the hairy everlasting, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in grasslands and rocky areas. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flower heads and hairy, grayish-green foliage. It produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into small, dry fruits called achenes. Gnaphalium adenocarpum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
